snippet: Many of the largest European countries, including France and Italy, are now rebelling against the German gospel of belt-tightening and calling for more radical steps to reverse their slumping fortunes.
abstract: Many of largest European countries, including France and Italy, are rebelling against German austerity measures and demanding more radical steps to reverse slumping fortunes; France, Italy and European Central Bank have coalesced into a bloc, pressing Germany to temper its insistence on budgetary discipline and to spend more on public works to stimulate eurozone economy.

byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and JACK EWING
byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Milan, and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt. Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Milan.

lead_paragraph: Many of the largest European countries, including France and Italy, are now rebelling against the German gospel of belt-tightening and calling for more radical steps to reverse their slumping fortunes.

headline.main: Bloc in Europe Starts to Balk Over Austerity
headline.print_headline: Large Nations in Europe Balk at German Gospel of Austerity
